H0.text: who was allowed to vote in the roman republic. All Roman citizens

H1.text: who was allowed to vote in the roman republic. Only landowners

H2.text: who was allowed to vote in the roman republic. Male citizens over 18

H3.text: who was allowed to vote in the roman republic. unknown

A4.text: An adult male citizen with the full complement of legal and political rights was called optimo iure (lit. 'having the greatest rights')

A5.text: Citizens optimo iure could participate in assemblies that elected magistrates, enacted legislation, presided over trials in capital cases, declared war and peace, and forged or dissolved treaties
